text:
We switched over our DNS over to HubSpot. We added the CNAME but the root domain is going to old site so <https://domain.com> not going to <https://www.domain.com>

UPDATE: All sorted using a htaccess rewrite rule, for those who are interested -

```<IfModule mod_rewrite.c>
	RewriteCond %{HTTPS} off [OR]
	RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} !^www\. [NC]
	RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} ^(.*)$  [NC]
	RewriteRule (.*) <https://www>.%1/$1 [R=301,L]
</IfModule>```

Hello everyone,
I’m Daniel. A Frontend Developer with 3 years of experience, working for the first time with HubSpot in my current job.

I’m from Amsterdam :slightly_smiling_face:, Just wanted to ask a quick question, does anyone knows what kind of theme/extension this guy -> <https://app.HubSpot.com/academy/5207114/lessons/673/3418> is using to highlight HubL syntax (I’m using VS code too).

Thanks in advance!

I believe he’s using Better Jinja. HubL is HubSpot’s proprietary version of Jinjava, which is based on Jinja.

As a result jinja tools often work for HubL as well.
Thank you!
